page.title: 05HOUSING IN BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: All of the older houses in Barnoldswick are stone built with natural blue slate roofs. The majority of these are through-terraced houses with just a few back-to-back terraces remaining near the centre of the town. Most of these houses were built around 1900. Barnoldswick expanded rapidly with the introduction of cotton mills to the area. A few older houses have been cleared and replaced with modern brick built semis,detached houses and also some old folks homes,but many have been renovated and now make sound family houses or charming cottage type properties. Around the outskirts of the town modern housing estates have sprung up. These consist of detached and semi- detached houses and bungalows built in a variety of materials.
